subject: Web3
title: NFT Rug Pulls
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on NFT Rug Pulls.

hook.text: A 'rug pull' is when NFT creators take buyers' money and disappear. It happened thousands of times.

buildup.text: Scammers created fake projects with stolen art, promised roadmaps, and hyped them on social media.

discovery.text: Once the mint sold out, the creators deleted their accounts, drained the funds, and vanished.

twist.text: The Frosties NFT rug pull made headlines when the FBI actually arrested the two creators months later.

climax.text: Rug pulls damaged public trust in NFTs more than any price crash. The scams defined the narrative.

punchline.text: Thousands of projects took the money and ran.

quiz.question: What is an NFT 'rug pull'?
options: Creators taking buyers' money and disappearing
